instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message:
Hi, got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no keyboard (trackpad works allright)

Keyboard connector looks good.

Each time i turn on the laptop after disconnecting the battery there's a kernel panic, but then it boots regularly. 

Diagnostics throw nothing. 

Tried different trackpad and different flex. No avail. 

I get 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_IPD_F</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_IPD_F</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>TPAD_KBD_3V3_WAKE_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: I dont have a keyboard to test for this model, but i have never seen a keyboard gone bad where 100% of the keys doesnt work

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message:
Keyboard connects with trackpad, not directly to MLB.
If trackpad and its flex are 100% discarded, what else???
